question: You enter a tavern and find an old man at the bar. He says to you: “Welcome, traveler! If you’re going to stay here in town, you need to get a job. But first we need to find out more about you so you can find the best job for you.”
“What is so special about you anyway? Tell me about yourself.”
“Sounds good enough. But we need to see what you’re actually good at.”
“What kind of abilities and skills have you developed in your experiences? How will you survive out there?”
“Not bad. We could probably find something for you.”
“What kind of work experience have you had out in the wastes? Have you been a hired gun, a caravan guard, or a trader? Can you fix broken tech?”
“How long were you doing that for?”
“What kind of challenges have you faced doing that? Have you had to deal with raiders, mutants, or radscorpions?”
“Is that it? Or have you done anything else?”
“Sounds like you had some interesting times. Let’s find out how smart you are.”
“What kind of special learning have you got out there? Did you attend the prestigious vault-tec university or learn on the job as a wasteland scavenger?”
“What kinds of things did you learn?”
“You might be pretty smart! We will have to find you something really good.”

“What are some of your proudest accomplishments out in the wasteland? Have you defeated a legendary deathclaw, uncovered hidden caches of valuable loot, or successfully negotiated a peace treaty between rival factions?”
“Okay we can work with this. You’re ready to start work. Here take this.”
